'Monchy' is a former settlement in Saskatchewan, Canada on the border with the
United States. Monchy is the transition point between Saskatchewan Highway 4 and
U.S. Route 191. Originally a small settlement it is now primarily a border
crossing. On the opposite side of the border in Morgan, Montana.

The border crossing is staffed by the Canadian Border Services Agency during the
day and closed at night. {{Citation
  | last =Canadian Border Services Agency first = author-link =Canadian Border
  | Services Agency last2 = first2 = author2-link = title = MONCHY - Office
  | Details date = year = url =http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/contact/listing/offices/office628-
  | e.html accessdate = 18 April 2011 }} The border crossing consists of a
  | customs building, residence and three storage buildings {{Citation last
  | =Canadian Border Services Agency first = author-link =Treasury Board of
  | Canada last2 = first2 = author2-link = title = Monchy Border Crossing (CBSA)
  | date = year = url =http://www.tbs-sct.gc.ca/dfrp-rbif/pn-nb/13475-
  | eng.aspx?&qid= accessdate = 22 April 2011 }} Growing pressure on both
  | the Canada and US side of the border to expand the boarder crossing to 24
  | hour operation, {{cite web
|url = http://www.prairiepost.com/news/sw-sask-news/politics/2554-us-supports-24-hour-
port-for-southwest-sask.html |title = US supports 24-hour port for southwest
Sask. |publisher = Prairie Post.com |accessdate =20 June 2011}}
